Incidents.Name: Cerritos Fire
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
Demob (release) of crews underway.
The fire will be transitioned from Incident Command Team #9 back to the CDF Riverside Unit/Riverside County Fire on Saturday morning, May 8, 2004.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Cerritos Fire took place in the CDF Riverside Unit/Riverside County Fire  between May 3-7, 2005, burning 16,460 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Cerritos, Riverside, Corona, human

Incidents.Name: French Fire
Incidents.Location: Located on both sides of Trinity Mountain Road within and around the community of French Gulch, west of Redding.
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
Damage assessment is complete and shows that 101 structures were saved in this very difficult fire fight.
Continued suppression within containment lines will be ongoing until all hotspots are out.
Demob (release) of resources ongoing.
The Lake Fire which broke out on the same date as the French Fire was approximately 100 acres and is 100% contained.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The French Fire took place in the CDF Shasta-Trinity Unit between August 14-21, 2004, burning 13,005 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: French, Gulch, Shasta, Trinity, Redding

Incidents.Name: Geysers Fire
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
Even with evacuations lifted and roadways open, firefighters are still mopping up throughout the entire fire area, and utility workers are replacing downed and damaged lines and poles. Residents returning to the area are asked to use caution and please drive slowly
Release of resources no longer needed will be ongoing.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Geysers Fire took place in the CDF Sonoma-Lake-Napa Unit between September 3-10, 2004, burning 12,525 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Sonoma, Lake, Napa, Geyserville, 2005

Incidents.Name: Bear Fire
Incidents.ControlStatement: Full control estimated August 19, 2004 at 6:00 p.m
Incidents.ConditionStatement: Demobilization of resources continues. Minor burning continues within the perimeter of the fire. Evacuation Center moved from Bella Vista Elementary School to Shasta College due to smoke in the area. Evacuation Center # 530-243-3021.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Bear Fire took place in the CDF Shasta-Trinity Unit between August 11-16, 2004, burning 10,484 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Bear, Jones, Shasta, Trinity, human, equipment

Incidents.Name: Eagle Fire
Incidents.Location: Southeast of the city of Temecula
Incidents.ControlStatement: Expected Control on May 8, 2004 at 6 p.m.
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
Demob (release) of crews ongoing.
The fire will be transitioned from Incident Command Team #8 back to the CDF Riverside Unit/Riverside County Fire on Saturday morning, May 8, 2004.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Eagle Fire took place in the CDF Riverside Unit/Riverside County Fire  between May 2-7 2004, burning 8,900 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Eagle, Riverside, Temecula

Incidents.Name: Mataguay Fire
Incidents.ConditionStatement: Incident Command Team #10 will transition control of the fire back to the CDF San Diego Unit at 1:00 p.m. today.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Mataguay Fire took place in the CDF San Diego Unit between July 13-16, 2004, burning 8,867 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: San, Diego, Warner, Springs, human, Mataguay

Incidents.Name: Gaviota Fire
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
Fire transitioned back to Santa Barbara County Fire.
Resources will continue to be released.
Final mop up and contol underway.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Gaviota Fire took place in the Santa Barbara County between June 5-12 2004, burning 7,440 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Gaviota, Santa, Barbara

Incidents.Name: Calaveras Complex
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
There are three fires burning in Calaveras County and for operational purposes CDF is referring to them as the Calaveras Complex. Those fires include: Armstrong Fire - 87 acres - 1 residence and 3 outbuildings destroyed
Mineral Fire - 879 acres - 1 residence and 4 outbuildings destroyed
The Armstrong and Mineral Fires were determined to be Arson
Copper Fire - 3445 acres - 1 outbuilding and 1 trailer were destroyed.
Cause of the Copper Fire has been determined to be a vehicle with mechanical problems traveling east bound on Hwy 4.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Calaveras Complex took place in the CDF Tuolumne-Calaveras Unit between August 7-10, 2004, burning 4,411 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Calaveras, Complex, Tuolumne, Angels, Camp, Mineral, Armstrong, Copper, arson, vehcile

Incidents.Name: Straylor Fire
Incidents.Location: 20 miles southeast of Fall River Mills
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
Three people were hurt July 26, when a contract helicopter crashed while on a reconnaissance flight. 
The pilot and two observers suffered minor to major injuries.
A CDF Serious Accident Investigation Team is on scene.
The majority of resources will go through demobilization today.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Straylor Fire took place in the CDF Lassen-Modoc Unit between July 22-30, 2004, burning 3,422 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Straylor, Lassen, Modoc, Fall, River, Mills,

Incidents.Name: Pattison Fire
Incidents.Location: Pattison Road, 2 miles north of Burson.
Incidents.ControlStatement: Full control expected September 9 at 8:00 a.m.
Incidents.ConditionStatement: Resources will continue to be released as they are no longer needed.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Pattison Fire took place in the CDF Tuolumne-Calaveras Unit between September 3-5, 2004, burning 2,676 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Pattison, Tuolumne, Calaveras, Burson

Incidents.Name: Oregon Fire
Incidents.Location: Oregon Gulch Road at Potters Ranch Road - West side of Lake Oroville near the Community of Cherokee
Incidents.ConditionStatement: Heavy vegetation, high temperatures, low humidities.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Oregon Fire took place in the CDF Butte Unit between August 11-13, 2004, burning 2,030 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Oregon, Butte, Gulch, Potters, Cherokee, Oroville

Incidents.Name: Old Hwy Fire
Incidents.ControlStatement: Full Control on September 17 at 6:00 pm
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
Resources will continue to be released as control is achieved.
Arrest of an arson suspect was made and the suspect was arraigned on September 14, 2004
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Old Hwy Fire took place in the CDF Madera-Mariposa-Merced Unit between September 13-14, 2004, burning 1,413 acres.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Mariposa, Old, Hwy, Madera, Merced, Human

Incidents.Name: Stevens Fire
